title: Knockout blow in Pacquiao-Horn fight?
text:
NRL needs trade window for players’ sake 
BRITAIN’S former world champ Amir Khan could knock Brisbane’s Jeff Horn out of his dream fight with Manny Pacquiao. 
England’s Daily Mirror reports today that the former world light-welterweight champion had agreed to terms with Pacquiao’s trainer Bob Arum to fight his former training partner. 
Pacquiao has yet to sign the deal. 
Arum had been negotiating with New Zealand-based Duco Events to stage a Pacquiao-Horn fight at Suncorp Stadium with multimillion-dollar backing from the Queensland Government and Brisbane City Council. media_camera Canelo Alvarez knocks out Amir Khan. Picture: Getty Images 
But Pacquiao, 38, recently asked his fans to choose his next opponent with Khan topping the vote at almost 50 per cent. Horn received just seven per cent of the vote . 
While Pacquiao says his next fight will be held in either Dubai or Abu Dhabi, Khan’s team told reporters they could stage the fight at Bolton’s Macron Stadium. 
Khan’s team approached Arum last month in Las Vegas. media_camera Jeff Horn has been in training to fight Manny Pacquiao. Picture: Stewart McLean 
The British fighter, of Pakistani heritage, suffered a crushing knockout against Mexican Saul “Canelo’’ Alvarez in his last fight and has just undergone hand surgery. 
He is embroiled in a sex tape scandal and is reported to have recently lost $6 million in a construction deal that went wrong. 
British boxing great Barry McGuigan has warned Khan not to take the fight after the savage loss to Alvarez in Las Vegas in May.
